history.content:
It depends on your level of experience with the topics and comfort with the matieral/way of thinking. 

I am taking Data100 right now after taking Data8, and CS61a, b, c. The homeworks take a chunk of time (between 4-6 hours for me) because they are long, but they are not very hard because its a reiteration of the "computational" style of thinking I developed in my previous classes. 

Side note: this opinion may change after we get past the "intro" matieral so if anyone who's completed the entire course wants to chime in that would add a more rounded opinion. 

In contrast, I took Stat/Prob 140 with only Math1b and Stat88 under my belt and it was very difficult and time consuming. Upper div probbility was fascinating but difficult for me to grasp so I spent about 10-15 hours on the homework each week. If you are taking it with more math classes under your belt you will have a slightly easier time simply because of the mathematical maturity you've built up (side note #2: mathematical maturity really is a thing. I scoffed about this up until this semester when I finally felt like my blood sweat and tears that I poured into all the math prereqs actually give me an advantage). 

Stat/Prob140 is difficult and Professor Adhikari expects a lot, but I HIGHLY recommend the class - the matieral was fascinating on its own, and the intrigue heightened even  more by the addition of tying it to Data Science (of which it seems you've expressed an interest). 

tl;dr: Stat/Prob140 is more work than Data100, but will be manageable with two light other class. 

If you don't have as many other Stat/CS class experience, these will be slightly harder (they will just take more time), so make sure the other courses are light.

Hello! Was wondering about how the workload of Stat 140 and Data 100 would be together. Considering taking these with two relatively light classes. Thank you.
history.subject: Workload: Stat/Prob 140 + Data 100
